H0.text: Conduction caused the repulsion of the negative charges in the small pieces of paper when a negatively charged rubber rod was brought near them.

H1.text: Gravitation caused the repulsion of the negative charges in the small pieces of paper when a negatively charged rubber rod was brought near them, as the rodâ€™s charges repelled the negative charges in the pieces.

H2.text: Induction caused the repulsion of the negative charges in the small pieces of paper when a negatively charged rubber rod was brought near them.

H3.text: Insulation caused the repulsion of the negative charges in the small pieces of paper when a negatively charged rubber rod was brought near them.

A4.text: Electrostatic induction causes the attraction of nonconductive objects like paper to static charges due to the redistribution of charges within the molecules.
